channel.title: Can't seem to save Inlets and Outlets in patch/patcher
channel.description:
Seems simple enough,
1. I added a patch/patcher 2. Hit edit 3. Went to inlets, added two inlets 4. Went to outlets, added an outlet 5. Closed the window 6. Hit update in the patch/patcher node 7. No inlets or outlets 8. Opened the embedded patch properties window, all inlets and outlets are gone
Seems I've made some elementary error, but no idea what!

item.title: Can't seem to save Inlets and Outlets in patch/patcher
item.dc:creator: @blackmountain Paul
item.description:
@blackmountain wrote:

Great, that's all fine, thanks for your help again.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't seem to save Inlets and Outlets in patch/patcher
item.dc:creator: @blackmountain Paul
item.description:
@blackmountain wrote:

Good tip about the midi object.

Yes, I didn't know there were inlet and outlet objects, but that makes a lot of sense, I'll try that when I get some free time again.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't seem to save Inlets and Outlets in patch/patcher

item.title: Can't seem to save Inlets and Outlets in patch/patcher
item.dc:creator: @janvantomme Jan Vantomme
item.description:
@janvantomme wrote:

Looks like your subpatch was missing the inlet and outlet objects in the file you posted.

Best practice is also to put the midi/in/keyb object inside your subpatch so you can use it as a polyphonic synth voice.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't seem to save Inlets and Outlets in patch/patcher
item.dc:creator: @blackmountain Paul
item.description:
@blackmountain wrote:

Sure, but theres not much to see here

I was wondering if I'm doing something very silly.

main.axp (3.3 KB)

I just want to learn how to make these sub patches, so I want to put my oscillator and adsr inside the patch and connect the midi in and audio out to inlets and outlets created on the patch.
